title: 107_hr2252
content: The Act titled "Conduit Contribution Prevention Act of 2001" increases penalties for violations of conduit contribution ban. The Act "Conduit Contribution Prevention Act of 2001" increases civil and criminal penalties for knowing and willful violations of the Federal Election Campaign Act of 1971. Civil penalties are increased to not less than 300 percent and not more than $50,000 or 1000 percent of the amount involved in the violation. Criminal penalties are also increased accordingly. The Act "Conduit Contribution Prevention Act of 2001" increases penalties for violations of the Federal Election Campaign Act of 1971. Civil penalties range from 300 percent to $50,000 or 1000 percent of the violation amount. Criminal penalties include fines and imprisonment for knowingly and willfully committing violations involving $1,000 or more. The United States Sentencing Commission will establish guidelines for penalties related to violations of section 320 of the Federal Election Campaign Act of 1971, with penalties not exceeding $50,000 or 1000 percent of the violation amount. The United States Sentencing Commission will establish guidelines for penalties related to violations of section 320 of the Federal Election Campaign Act of 1971, considering variations in the contribution amount made in violation of the act. The guideline must be promulgated within 90 days after the Act of 1971, with an explanation submitted to Congress. The United States Sentencing Commission must establish guidelines for penalties related to violations of section 320 of the Federal Election Campaign Act of 1971 within 90 days of the Act's enactment. Amendments are made to the Sentencing Reform Act of 1987 to ensure compliance with the new guideline. Amendments are made to the Federal Election Campaign Act of 1971 regarding penalties for violations of section 320. The amendments include mandatory referral to the Attorney General and an extension of the statute of limitations. These changes apply to violations occurring after the enactment of the Act. The Federal Election Campaign Act of 1971 is amended to extend the ban on foreign contributions to all campaign-related disbursements, including those to political committees and for independent expenditures. The amendments apply to disbursements made after the enactment of the Act.
